item.title: Comment on Reflections on Palantir by Eltoro
item.description:
Well that was certainly stuffed full of self-congratulatory silicon valley cliches. I read it as an exercise in identity formation for someone who belongs to that class of people who are hangers on in silicon valley - the ones who are peripheral but the most ardent participants in the cult of stoicism and ***moving fast*** hero worship, and who validate their ideas of self by claiming to be part of some exclusive, elite club (but who, curiously, don't seem to have made the money that people who are really in the club have made).

Strong vibes of management consultants and investment bankers who think they're virile, modern day warriors.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/10/reflections-on-palantir.html?commentID=160823289

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/10/reflections-on-palantir.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=reflections-on-palantir

item.title: Comment on Google signs contract for small modular nuclear reactors by JWatts
item.description:
Reply to Oldcurmudgeon:

A notoriously fickle company with no nuclear operating experience buying a first-of-kind reactor design…nah, it will be fine.

It looks like Google is just making a power purchase agreement. So, it's not really much risk on their end. And it doesn't imply or require any nuclear power expertise on Googles part.
